messages.message:
Hi team,
Is it expected that while building an app, the output directory and the ibflowresults/ibflowbin files etc. are created in the same storage as where the files are imported from?
I created a new Build project and imported a directory from my Instabase Google Drive. When I clicked on the “Preview App” button, it created an `output` directory with a bunch of stuff inside it in the Google Drive folder. I would imagine we don’t want to create these flow binary files and other files in the users’ cloud storage; we only want to use them as input sources?

we should be creating the `output` directory inside `my-repo/fs/Instabase Drive`, so it should never go into a drive of a different name

can you provide the entire IB FS path to this `output` directory created inside your Google Drive?

Hmm I ended up unmounting the drive since then but here is the full fs path to the input directory `https://aihub.dev.instabase.com/yash.botadra/my-repo/fs/My GDrive/Sample Docs/` . The `output` directory was created in this directory.
ahh ok this is a bug then. i saved it in the directory because that was what we were doing previously. i can put up a fix for this tomorrow
